Bullard ISD has been actively monitoring the weather for tomorrow. Our Bullard ISD Safety Team participated in a National Weather Service conference call and visited with local meteorologists. Based on information gathered from those meetings, the primary concerns are heavy rainfall that could potentially cause flash flooding, along with significant wind gusts. This is predicted to occur at our regular arrival time for the school day while school buses are on the roads. Heavy winds, reduced visibility, and possible flooding on our rural roads are all factors that could affect the safety of our buses and families that will be traveling to school.

As a result, Bullard ISD will have a 2 hour delayed start for tomorrow, Thursday, August 27, 2020. School buses will run and campuses will open 2 hours later than their regular schedule.

Continue to watch our website, social media, and call outs for more updates.

Summer school bus plans

BISD will running four buses for summer school students, and we will be following CDC guidelines. The maximum number of students per bus should not exceed 12 students.

Each bus will have a monitor, and social distancing will be followed.

Prior to entering the bus, student temperatures will be taken with a non-contact infrared thermometer. If the student has a temperature of 100.5 or higher, the student will be asked to return home. If there is no one at home to receive the student, the student will be placed in a mask and seated in the first seat by the door. Once at school, school personnel will contact a parent or guardian.
